commit_message:
Updates .gitignore

To ignore swap files from getting into repository
currently the implemented ignore is *.swp
however vim adds more swap files if these files exists,
so improving this with *.sw?

Change-Id: I9384015efdd1bc2a9bbfe6f25552cd909b155998
Closes-Bug: #1255876
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-neutronclient refs/changes/26/59026/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Remove mox usage from test_baremetal_nodes.py

Use mock instead of mox, because mock works with both Python 2 & 3

Change-Id: I8437e459f66d0d0ee78f23d5ae4224d88846cd65

commit_message:
VMware: add support for VM diagnostics

The drivers now return diagnostics for a requested VM.

Implements blueprint vmware-vm-diagnostics

VMware specific keys will be namespaced.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I08f199f7e3b4edafe60ce73d2fc833f8c5a5574e

commit_message:
Make db API respect context show_deleted

Currently the soft-delete aware stuff in the DB api only respects
flags passed in directly, not the context.show_deleted, so align
the code with what is implied by existing comments and respect
the flag in the context too.

Change-Id: I88cd1a8862a2a53c314849e11d026182180bce9b
blueprint: request-scoping-policy

added_lines: def test_stack_get_show_deleted_context(self): stack = self._setup_test_stack('stack', UUID1)[1] self.assertFalse(self.ctx.show_deleted) st = db_api.stack_get(self.ctx, UUID1) self.assertEqual(UUID1, st.id) stack.delete() st = db_api.stack_get(self.ctx, UUID1) self.assertIsNone(st) self.ctx.show_deleted = True st = db_api.stack_get(self.ctx, UUID1) self.assertEqual(UUID1, st.id)

commit_message:
Fix i18n messages in neutronclient

Using tools/check_i18n.py to scan source directory, and fix most of
the errors.
    - Message internationalization
    - First letter must be capital
    - Using comma instead of percent in LOG.xxx

Partial-Bug: #1217100
Change-Id: I312f999f97e33d84c3f06fa1caacf32affc26a78

commit_message:
Test MAC address should be 6 octets.

Since nova commit Idcba745a011604d7664b62d88f1dede88d10443d, the nova
api now validates MAC addresses.  The test MAC address we were using in
register-nodes was not valid.

Change-Id: I0e60a20e503098532b81c5ee7942e99f0180a4f9

commit_message:
Extend devtest_overcloud timeout by 5 minutes

We have seen that the overcloud is taking a bit longer to come up for
some reason. This change gives it 5 more minutes.

commit_message:
Create_snapshot api works with TaskFlow 0.1.

Cinder API.create_snapshot command was reimplemented to
work with TaskFlow 0.1.

Change-Id: I86c173cb9c406c876011707eed0e00b5e9a387a9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/34/55134/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # -*- coding: utf-8 -*- # vim: tabstop=4 shiftwidth=4 softtabstop=4 # Copyright (C) 2013 Yahoo! Inc. All Rights Reserved. # Copyright (c) 2013 OpenStack Foundation # Copyright 2010 United States Government as represented by the # Administrator of the National Aeronautics and Space Administration. # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from oslo.config import cfg from cinder import exception from cinder import flow_base from cinder.openstack.common import log as logging from cinder import quota from cinder.volume.flows import common import taskflow.engines from taskflow.patterns import linear_flow LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) ACTION = 'volume:create_snapshot' CONF = cfg.CONF QUOTAS = quota.QUOTAS class CheckMigrationStatusTask(flow_base.CinderTask): def execute(self, volume): if volume['migration_status'] != None: # Volume is migrating, wait until done msg = _("Volume cannot be deleted while migrating") raise exception.InvalidVolume(reason=msg) class CheckStatusTask(flow_base.CinderTask): def execute(self, volume, force): if ((not force) and (volume['status'] != "available")): msg = _("must be available") raise exception.InvalidVolume(reason=msg) class ExtractVolumeTask(flow_base.CinderTask): def __init__(self, **kwargs): super(ExtractVolumeTask, self).__init__( provides=('volume_id', 'volume_type_id', 'size'), **kwargs) def execute(self, volume): return volume['id'], volume['volume_type_id'], volume['size'] class QuotaReserveOptsTask(flow_base.CinderTask): def __init__(self, **kwargs): super(QuotaReserveOptsTask, self).__init__(provides="reserve_opts", **kwargs) def execute(self, volume): reserve_opts = {'snapshots': 1} if not CONF.no_snapshot_gb_quota: reserve_opts.update({'gigabytes': volume['size']}) return reserve_opts def handle_quota_reserve_exception(e, context, size): overs = e.kwargs['overs'] usages = e.kwargs['usages'] quotas = e.kwargs['quotas'] def _consumed(name): return (usages[name]['reserved'] + usages[name]['in_use']) for over in overs: if 'gigabytes' in over: msg = _("Quota exceeded for %(s_pid)s, tried to create " "%(s_size)sG snapshot (%(d_consumed)dG of " "%(d_quota)dG already consumed)") LOG.warn(msg % {'s_pid': context.project_id, 's_size': size, 'd_consumed': _consumed(over), 'd_quota': quotas[over]}) raise exception.VolumeSizeExceedsAvailableQuota( requested=size, consumed=_consumed('gigabytes'), quota=quotas['gigabytes']) elif 'snapshots' in over: msg = _("Quota exceeded for %(s_pid)s, tried to create " "snapshot (%(d_consumed)d snapshots " "already consumed)") LOG.warn(msg % {'s_pid': context.project_id, 'd_consumed': _consumed(over)}) raise exception.SnapshotLimitExceeded( allowed=quotas[over]) class CreateSnapshotTask(flow_base.CinderTask): def __init__(self, db): super(CreateSnapshotTask, self).__init__(provides='snapshot') self._db = db def execute(self, context, volume, name, description, metadata): options = { 'volume_id': volume['id'], 'user_id': context.user_id, 'project_id': context.project_id, 'status': "creating", 'progress': '0%', 'volume_size': volume['size'], 'display_name': name, 'display_description': description, 'volume_type_id': volume['volume_type_id'], 'encryption_key_id': volume['encryption_key_id'], 'metadata': metadata } snapshot = self._db.snapshot_create(context, options) return snapshot def revert(self, context, volume, **kwargs): self.db.snapshot_destroy(context, volume['id']) class VolumeCreateSnapshotTask(flow_base.CinderTask): def __init__(self, volume_rpcapi, **kwargs): super(VolumeCreateSnapshotTask, self).__init__(**kwargs) self._volume_rpcapi = volume_rpcapi def execute(self, context, volume, snapshot): self._volume_rpcapi.create_snapshot(context, volume, snapshot) def get_api_flow(db, volume_rpcapi, **flow_data): """Constructs and returns the api entrypoint flow. This flow will do the following: 1. Checks volume statuses. 2. Extracts volume parameters. 3. Reserves the quota (reverts quota on any failures). 4. Creates the database entry. 5. Commits the quota (reverts quota on any failures). 6. Creates volume snapshot. """ flow_name = ACTION.replace(":", "_") + "_api" api_flow = linear_flow.Flow(flow_name) api_flow.add( common.PolicyEnforceTask(ACTION, rebind={'target_obj': 'volume'}), CheckMigrationStatusTask(), CheckStatusTask(), ExtractVolumeTask(), QuotaReserveOptsTask(), common.QuotaReserveTask(ACTION, handle_quota_reserve_exception), common.CheckMetadataPropertiesTask(), CreateSnapshotTask(db), common.QuotaCommitTask(ACTION), VolumeCreateSnapshotTask(volume_rpcapi) ) # Load (but not run) the flow using the provided initial data. engine = taskflow.engines.load(api_flow, store=flow_data) flow_base.attach_debug_listeners(engine) return engine

commit_message:
Roles can now be managed through release handler

Removed creating of new roles through nodes (now it's foreign key)

Change-Id: I0524d1ff12e0cb7938f9cca6dfc4c10c66f5e801

commit_message:
Add config option to limit image members

This patch adds the image_member_quota config option. This allows a deployer
to limit the number of image members allowed per image. The default value
is 128, to be consistent with other quota defaults. Users will only be able
to update an image if the result of the transaction would be under this limit.

This is for both Glance v1 and v2

Fixes bug 1252459
docImpact

commit_message:
Revert "ML2 plugin should not delete ports on subnet deletion"

This reverts commit 0d131ff0e9964cb6a65f64809270f9d597c2d5d1

There is really no problem with this change. However, it is probably
triggering a port_update notification to the agent for each port
with an allocated IP.
The agent handles that notification in a way which might be improved
from a scalability perspective.

I don't actually want this change to removed, I am just checking
whether neutron without it passess jobs.

Change-Id: I5494b607127b261043dcddfdc10c93a28ec20af5
Related-Bug: 1253896
Related-Bug: 1254236

commit_message:
ML2 plugin should not delete ports on subnet deletion

On subnet deletion ports are deleted asynchronously by dhcp agent
so plugin doesn't need to delete them itself.
Instead Ml2Plugin.delete_subnet() method should call update_port()
for each allocation to remove the IP from the port and call the MechanismDrivers.
The patch also adds subnets test suite from test_db_plugin to test_ml2_plugin.

Closes-Bug: #1246737
Change-Id: I7cf0461e9a3cfec4921e2de41fb1ab3fc119fddc

commit_message:
Refactors network test in scenario to support advanced network test

1. Adds VM connectivity check test between VMs in the same subnet.
2. Adds VM connectivity check test after VM resized.

Change-Id: I03988777be3f3a7ac363eb6d28c5d8dde866a259
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/18/58718/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from tempest.common.utils.data_utils import rand_namefrom tempest.scenario import base_network_opsclass TestNetworkBasicOps(base_network_ops.BaseNetworkOps): def _check_same_net_vms_connectivity(self): if not self.config.network.tenant_networks_reachable: msg = 'Tenant networks not configured to be reachable.' LOG.info(msg) return if not self.networks: self._create_networks() network = self.networks[-1] test_servers = [] for i in range(2): name = rand_name('server-smoke-%d-' % i) test_servers.append(self._create_server(name, network)) ssh_login = self.config.compute.image_ssh_user private_key = self.keypairs[self.tenant_id].private_key ips = [] for server in test_servers: for net_name, ip_addresses in server.networks.iteritems(): for ip_address in ip_addresses: self._check_vm_connectivity(ip_address, ssh_login, private_key) ips.append(ip_address) self.assertTrue(self._ping_from_vm(ips[0], ssh_login, private_key, ips[1])) self.assertTrue(self._ping_from_vm(ips[1], ssh_login, private_key, ips[0])) self._check_same_net_vms_connectivity()
deleted_lines: from tempest.api.network import common as net_commonfrom tempest.common.utils import data_utils from tempest import configfrom tempest.scenario import managerclass TestNetworkBasicOps(manager.NetworkScenarioTest): CONF = config.TempestConfig() @classmethod def check_preconditions(cls): super(TestNetworkBasicOps, cls).check_preconditions() cfg = cls.config.network if not (cfg.tenant_networks_reachable or cfg.public_network_id): msg = ('Either tenant_networks_reachable must be "true", or ' 'public_network_id must be defined.') cls.enabled = False raise cls.skipException(msg) @classmethod def setUpClass(cls): super(TestNetworkBasicOps, cls).setUpClass() cls.check_preconditions() # TODO(mnewby) Consider looking up entities as needed instead # of storing them as collections on the class. cls.keypairs = {} cls.security_groups = {} cls.networks = [] cls.subnets = [] cls.routers = [] cls.servers = [] cls.floating_ips = {} def _get_router(self, tenant_id): """Retrieve a router for the given tenant id. If a public router has been configured, it will be returned. If a public router has not been configured, but a public network has, a tenant router will be created and returned that routes traffic to the public network. """ router_id = self.config.network.public_router_id network_id = self.config.network.public_network_id if router_id: result = self.network_client.show_router(router_id) return net_common.AttributeDict(**result['router']) elif network_id: router = self._create_router(tenant_id) router.add_gateway(network_id) return router else: raise Exception("Neither of 'public_router_id' or " "'public_network_id' has been defined.") def _create_router(self, tenant_id, namestart='router-smoke-'): name = data_utils.rand_name(namestart) body = dict( router=dict( name=name, admin_state_up=True, tenant_id=tenant_id, ), ) result = self.network_client.create_router(body=body) router = net_common.DeletableRouter(client=self.network_client, **result['router']) self.assertEqual(router.name, name) self.set_resource(name, router) return router def _create_keypairs(self): self.keypairs[self.tenant_id] = self.create_keypair( name=data_utils.rand_name('keypair-smoke-')) def _create_security_groups(self): self.security_groups[self.tenant_id] = self._create_security_group() def _create_networks(self): network = self._create_network(self.tenant_id) router = self._get_router(self.tenant_id) subnet = self._create_subnet(network) subnet.add_to_router(router.id) self.networks.append(network) self.subnets.append(subnet) self.routers.append(router) def _create_server(self, name, network): tenant_id = network.tenant_id keypair_name = self.keypairs[tenant_id].name security_groups = [self.security_groups[tenant_id].name] create_kwargs = { 'nics': [ {'net-id': network.id}, ], 'key_name': keypair_name, 'security_groups': security_groups, } server = self.create_server(name=name, create_kwargs=create_kwargs) return server def _create_servers(self): for i, network in enumerate(self.networks): name = data_utils.rand_name('server-smoke-%d-' % i) server = self._create_server(name, network) self.servers.append(server) def _assign_floating_ips(self): public_network_id = self.config.network.public_network_id for server in self.servers: floating_ip = self._create_floating_ip(server, public_network_id) self.floating_ips.setdefault(server, []) self.floating_ips[server].append(floating_ip)

commit_message:
VMs connectivity check in same subnet

Checks 2 VM's connectivity in the same subnet.

Change-Id: I9eb4e3a9f90e5005ba5513105938bbb6baf0459d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/99/59899/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from tempest.common.utils import data_utils def _check_same_net_vms_connectivity(self): if not self.config.network.tenant_networks_reachable: msg = 'Tenant networks not configured to be reachable.' LOG.info(msg) return if not self.networks: self._create_networks() network = self.networks[-1] test_servers = [] for i in range(2): name = data_utils.rand_name('server-smoke-%d-' % i) test_servers.append(self._create_server(name, network)) ssh_login = self.config.compute.image_ssh_user private_key = self.keypairs[self.tenant_id].private_key ips = [] for server in test_servers: for net_name, ip_addresses in server.networks.iteritems(): for ip_address in ip_addresses: self._check_vm_connectivity(ip_address, ssh_login, private_key) ips.append(ip_address) self.assertTrue(self._ping_ip_address_from_vm(ips[0], ssh_login, private_key, ips[1]), "Timed out to ping " "%(dest_ip)s from VM which IP is %(source_ip)s" % {"dest_ip": ips[1], "source_ip": ips[0]}) self.assertTrue(self._ping_ip_address_from_vm(ips[1], ssh_login, private_key, ips[0]), "Timed out to ping " "%(dest_ip)s from VM which IP is %(source_ip)s" % {"dest_ip": ips[0], "source_ip": ips[1]}) self._check_same_net_vms_connectivity()

commit_message:
Openstack Trove (DBaaS) resource

Implementing Database as a Service (Trove) resource.

Implements: blueprint dbaas-trove-resource

Change-Id: I8a925ba586f4e29a5208797d97d0b5d9d05aa1e3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/31/59231/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # vim: tabstop=4 shiftwidth=4 softtabstop=4 # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. try: from troveclient.exceptions import NotFound except ImportError: #Setup fake exception for unit testing without troveclient class NotFound(Exception): pass from heat.common import exception from heat.engine import properties from heat.engine import resource from heat.engine.resources import nova_utils from heat.openstack.common import log as logging logger = logging.getLogger(__name__) class OSDBInstance(resource.Resource): ''' Openstack cloud database resource. ''' database_schema = { "character_set": properties.Schema( properties.STRING, _("Set of symbols and encodings."), default="utf8", required=False), "collate": properties.Schema( properties.STRING, _("Set of rules for comparing characters in a character set."), default="utf8_general_ci", required=False), "name": properties.Schema( properties.STRING, _("Specifies database names for creating databases on instance" " creation."), required=True, constraints=[ properties.Length(max=64), properties.AllowedPattern( "[a-zA-Z0-9_]+[a-zA-Z0-9_@?#\s]*[a-zA-Z0-9_]+")]), } user_db_schema = { "name": properties.Schema( properties.STRING, _("User database schema."), required=True, constraints=[ properties.Length(max=64), properties.AllowedPattern( "[a-zA-Z0-9_]+[a-zA-Z0-9_@?#\s]*[a-zA-Z0-9_]+")]) } user_schema = { "name": properties.Schema( properties.STRING, _("User name to create a user on instance creation."), required=True, constraints=[ properties.Length(max=16), properties.AllowedPattern( "[a-zA-Z0-9_]+[a-zA-Z0-9_@?#\s]*[a-zA-Z0-9_]+")]), "password": properties.Schema( properties.STRING, _("Password for those users on instance creation."), required=True, constraints=[properties.AllowedPattern( "[a-zA-Z0-9_]+[a-zA-Z0-9_@?#\s]*[a-zA-Z0-9_]+")]), "host": properties.Schema( properties.STRING, _("The host from which a user is allowed to connect " "to the database."), default="%"), "databases": properties.Schema( properties.LIST, _("Names of databases that those users can access " "on instance creation."), required=True, schema=properties.Schema(properties.MAP, user_db_schema)) } properties_schema = { "name": properties.Schema( properties.STRING, _("Name of the DB instance to create."), required=True, constraints=[properties.Length(max=255)]), "flavor": properties.Schema( properties.STRING, _("Reference to a flavor for creating DB instance."), required=True), "size": properties.Schema( properties.INTEGER, _("Database volume size in GB."), required=True, constraints=[properties.Range(1, 150)]), "databases": properties.Schema( properties.LIST, _("List of databases to be created on DB instance creation."), required=False, default=[], schema=properties.Schema(properties.MAP, database_schema)), "users": properties.Schema( properties.LIST, _("List of users to be created on DB instance creation."), required=False, default=[], schema=properties.Schema(properties.MAP, user_schema)) } attributes_schema = { "hostname": _("Hostname of the instance"), "href": _("Api endpoint reference of the instance") } def __init__(self, name, json_snippet, stack): super(OSDBInstance, self).__init__(name, json_snippet, stack) self._hostname = None self._href = None self._dbinstance = None @property def dbinstance(self): """Get the trove dbinstance.""" if not self._dbinstance and self.resource_id: self._dbinstance = self.trove().instances.get(self.resource_id) return self._dbinstance def handle_create(self): ''' Create cloud database instance. ''' logger.info(_("OSDBInstance handle_create called")) self.dbinstancename = self.properties['name'] self.flavor = nova_utils.get_flavor_id(self.trove(), self.properties['flavor']) self.volume = {'size': self.properties['size']} self.databases = self.properties.get("databases", []) self.users = self.properties.get("users", []) # create db instance logger.info(_("Creating Cloud database %s") % self.dbinstancename) instance = self.trove().instances.create(self.dbinstancename, self.flavor, volume=self.volume, databases=self.databases, users=self.users) self.resource_id_set(instance.id) return instance def check_create_complete(self, instance): ''' Check if cloud DB instance creation is complete. ''' instance.get() # get updated attributes if instance.status == 'ERROR': raise exception.Error(_("Cloud DB instance creation failed.")) if instance.status != 'ACTIVE': return False msg = _("Cloud database %(database)s created (flavor:%(flavor)s, " "volume:%(volume)s)") logger.info(msg % ({'database': self.dbinstancename, 'flavor': self.flavor, 'volume': self.volume})) return True def handle_delete(self): ''' Delete a cloud database instance. ''' logger.info(_("OSDBInstance handle_delete called.")) if not self.resource_id: return instance = None try: instance = self.trove().instances.get(self.resource_id) except NotFound: logger.info(_("Cloud database %s not found.") % self.resource_id) self.resource_id_set(None) else: instance.delete() return instance def check_delete_complete(self, instance): ''' Check for completion of cloud DB instance delettion ''' if not instance: return True try: instance.get() except NotFound: logger.info(_("OSDBInstance %s deleted.") % self.resource_id) self.resource_id_set(None) return True return False def validate(self): ''' Validate any of the provided params ''' res = super(OSDBInstance, self).validate() if res: return res # check validity of user and databases users = self.properties.get('users', []) if not users: return databases = self.properties.get('databases', []) if not databases: return {'Error': _('Databases property is required if users property' ' is provided')} for user in users: if not user.get('databases', []): return {'Error': _('Must provide access to at least one database for ' 'user %s') % user['name']} missing_db = [db_name['name'] for db_name in user['databases'] if db_name['name'] not in [db['name'] for db in databases]] if missing_db: return {'Error': _('Database %s specified for user does not exist in ' 'databases.') % missing_db} def hostname(self): if not self._hostname and self.dbinstance: self._hostname = self.dbinstance.hostname return self._hostname def href(self): if not self._href and self.dbinstance: if not self.dbinstance.links: self._href = None else: for link in self.dbinstance.links: if link['rel'] == 'self': self._href = link['href'] break return self._href def _resolve_attribute(self, name): if name == 'hostname': return self.hostname() elif name == 'href': return self.href() def resource_mapping(): return { 'OS::Trove::DBInstance': OSDBInstance, }

commit_message:
Fix flavor names with Amazon prefix "m1"

* Remove Amazon specific prefix "m1" from flavor names.

Closes-Bug: #1161988

DocImpact

Change-Id: I4c4514b94bae46e58f5aa20309dc6384cf940868

commit_message:
Sync rpc from oslo

Changes in common.rpc since the last sync:

f88d59a Drop RPC securemessage.py
39f6589 Use localisation
8a3996a Fix missing space in help text
4bfb7a2 Apply six for metaclass
d7d74a7 Add `versionutils` for version compatibility checks
3cdd157 Add third element to RPC versions for backports

Change-Id: I000eaeca72113097e8de2194fcaeea9054028ed0

subject: Adding hardware-agent
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-08-21 08:31:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer/commit/4654c669a755ff8fdc5f66441f80ee243029a254', 'message': 'Adding hardware-agent

This is the first building block of adding basic monitoring for physical
devices, which is like the central-agent but polls the metrcis from
physical devices.

Part of the blueprint monitoring-physical-devices.

Rebased on the original code at https://github.com/graflu0/ceilometer
contributed by Lucas and Toni.

commit_message:
Adding hardware-agent

This is the first building block of adding basic monitoring for physical
devices, which is like the central-agent but polls the metrcis from
physical devices.

This patch also add an optional field 'resources' to pipeline
definition. It could be a list of resource URI from which the hardware
agent pollsters should poll from.

Part of the blueprint monitoring-physical-devices.

Based on the original code at https://github.com/graflu0/ceilometer
contributed by Lucas and Toni.

Change-Id: Ia56e74626f700c9bd647bf73584e98f6cf39f207
Signed-off-by: Lucas Graf <graflu0@students.zhaw.ch>
Signed-off-by: Toni Zehnder <zehndton@students.zhaw.ch>
Signed-off-by: Lianhao Lu <lianhao.lu@intel.com>

commit_message:
Reduce boilerplate code using get_client_manager

There are a few Tempest tests that contain boilerplate code used
to create an Openstack manager client. This commit removes this
boilerplate code with the following changes:

1. BaseTestCase.get_client_manager now generates different
   credentials based on the type of user type passed in. There
   are also optional keyword arguments to control the type of
   manager to be instantiate as well as an alternate manager type
   in case tenant isolation is disabled.

2. Updated all tests that are using tenant isolation to use the
   updated get_client_manager method

Closes-Bug: #1246932
Change-Id: I098fac5f7c475cab92f016fb98f55ad695bf945f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/56/54856/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def get_client_manager(cls, user_type='primary', manager=None, alt_manager=None): :param user_type: Type of user to generate credentials for. One of: (primary, admin, alt) :param alt: Manager type to use when isolation is not enabled username, tenant_name, password = { 'primary': cls.isolated_creds.get_primary_creds(), 'admin': cls.isolated_creds.get_admin_creds(), 'alt': cls.isolated_creds.get_alt_creds() }[user_type] manager = manager or clients.Manager alt_manager = alt_manager or clients.Manager os = manager(username=username, password=password, tenant_name=tenant_name, interface=cls._interface) else: os = alt_manager(interface=cls._interface)
deleted_lines: def get_client_manager(cls): creds = cls.isolated_creds.get_primary_creds() username, tenant_name, password = creds os = clients.Manager(username=username, password=password, tenant_name=tenant_name, interface=cls._interface) else: os = clients.Manager(interface=cls._interface)

commit_message:
add some negative tests for neutron

add one negative test for delete net
add two negative tests for subnet create and delete
add one negative test for delete port

Change-Id: Ibaf13e1c6c55b877213b2590e30acc7443cfbb0f

added_lines: @attr(type=['negative', 'smoke']) def test_delete_non_existent_net(self): #added by netease(jimmy) non_exist_id = rand_name('network') self.assertRaises(exceptions.NotFound, self.client.delete_network, non_exist_id) @attr(type=['negative', 'smoke']) def test_delete_non_existent_subnet(self): #added by netease(jimmy) non_exist_id = rand_name('subnet') self.assertRaises(exceptions.NotFound, self.client.delete_subnet, non_exist_id) @attr(type=['negative', 'smoke']) def test_delete_non_existent_port(self): #added by netease(jimmy) non_exist_id = rand_name('port') self.assertRaises(exceptions.NotFound, self.client.delete_port, non_exist_id) @attr(type=['negative', 'smoke']) def test_create_invalid_cidr_subnet(self): #added by netease(jimmy) #create network name = rand_name('network-') resp, body = self.client.create_network(name) self.assertEqual('201', resp['status']) network = body['network'] net_id = network['id'] invalid_cidr = '0.0.0.0' self.assertRaises(exceptions.BadRequest, self.client.create_subnet, net_id, invalid_cidr) #clean env resp, body = self.client.delete_network(net_id) self.assertEqual('204', resp['status'])

commit_message:
transport: simplify TransportURL constructor

This avoids making the TransportURL class needing a configuration object
altogether. The long term plan is to remove/deprecate all the
configuration object needing in transport.

Change-Id: Ifc6b8cad1b86bc8290796d59478ddfcf79c1f705
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.messaging refs/changes/68/56068/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: messaging.TransportURL.parse(self.expect['url'])] if self.url: url = messaging.TransportURL.parse(self.url) else: url = messaging.TransportURL(transport=self.rpc_backend) invoke_args = [self.conf, url]

commit_message:
"publicurl" should be required on endpoint-create

publicurl field is required and cannot be empty when create a endpoint in
keystone server.So the "--publicurl " also should set as mandatory in
keystoneclient.

Change-Id: Ia397c79a28dd3a6ddef141df0f7df30cc0bf7b6c
Closes-Bug: #1246335

commit_message:
Fix flavor names with Amazon prefix "m1"

* Remove Amazon specific prefix "m1" from flavor names.
* Amazon has the M1 prefix to denote high memory, and it also
  denotes that thhe instance created from M1 instance types are based on
  Intel Xeon processors.
* "m1" doesnt have any similar meaning in OpenStack. We dont map
  flavors to any specific hardware platform. Hence removing the prefix.

Change-Id: I4f71569cfb96255122db581b140addc0f25e87fa
Closes-Bug: #1161988

commit_message:
Adds scripts for virtualbox for Windows

Scripts helps you to deploy Mirantis OpenStack 3.2 PoC on VirtualBox for Windows.
Scripts structure is same as linux scripts.

Change-Id: Ie28636eea3e2bb5c49a0d317a605b695eaabb7f1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-main refs/changes/43/55843/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Option Explicit ' Copyright 2013 Mirantis, Inc. ' ' Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may ' not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain ' a copy of the License at ' ' http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 ' ' Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software ' distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT ' WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the ' License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations ' under the License. ' This file contains the functions to manage host-only interfaces in the system function get_hostonly_interfaces() ' Reads host-only interfaces names. ' Returns: string separated by CR LF. get_hostonly_interfaces = get_vbox_value ("list hostonlyifs", "Name") 'echo -e `VBoxManage list hostonlyifs | grep '^Name' | sed 's/^Name\:[ \t]*//' | uniq` end function function is_hostonly_interface_present(strIfName) ' Check if interface is in list of host-only interfaces ' Returns: boolean dim lstIfs, arrIfs, i lstIfs = get_hostonly_interfaces() arrIfs = Split(lstIfs,vbcrlf) ' Check that the list of interfaces contains the given interface is_hostonly_interface_present = false for i = 0 to Ubound(arrIfs) if arrIfs(i) = strIfName then is_hostonly_interface_present = True exit for end if next end function 'wscript.echo is_hostonly_interface_present("VirtualBox Host-Only Ethernet Adapter") function check_hostonly_interface(strIfName, strIp, strMask) ' Check if interface have given ip address and mask ' Returns: boolean Dim listing, arrLines, linesNb, i listing = get_vbox_value ("list hostonlyifs", "(Name|IPAddress|NetworkMask)") arrLines = Split(listing,vbcrlf) linesNb = Ubound(arrLines) + 1 if linesNb Mod 3 <> 0 then wscript.echo "Something went wrong..." exit function end if check_hostonly_interface = False for i = 0 to linesNb-1 step 2 if arrLines(i) = strIfName then if arrLines(i+1) = strIp and arrLines(i+2) = strMask then check_hostonly_interface = True else check_hostonly_interface = False end if exit for end if next end Function 'wscript.echo check_hostonly_interface("VirtualBox Host-Only Ethernet Adapter", "192.168.56.1", "255.255.255.0") function surely_create_hostonly_interface(byref strIfName, strIp, mask) ' Create hostonly interface and configure it with IP and mask. ' If created interface have different name value of strIfName variable changes. ' Sometimes VBoxManage can't properly configure IP at hostonly interface. ' In case if IP and mask not configured properly interface deleted and recreated in loop. ' Returns: nothing dim i, max_tries, sleep_seconds max_tries = 5 sleep_seconds = 5 surely_create_hostonly_interface = False for i = 1 to max_tries if is_hostonly_interface_present(strIfName) then delete_hostonly_interface strIfName WScript.sleep sleep_seconds * 1000 end if create_hostonly_interface strIfName, strIp, mask if is_hostonly_interface_present(strIfName) then if check_hostonly_interface (strIfName, strIp, mask) then surely_create_hostonly_interface = True exit for else wscript.echo "Interface was not created properly." end if end if WScript.sleep sleep_seconds * 1000 next end Function 'wscript.echo surely_create_hostonly_interface ("VirtualBox Host-Only Ethernet Adapter #8", "192.168.1.1", "255.255.255.0") function create_hostonly_interface(byref strIfName, strIp, strMask) ' Create hostonly interface and configure it with IP and mask ' If created interface have different name value of strIfName variable changes. ' Returns: nothing wscript.echo "Creating host-only interface (name ip netmask): " & strIfName & " " & strIp & " " & strMask ' Exit if the interface already exists (deleting it here is not safe, as VirtualBox creates hostonly adapters sequentially) if is_hostonly_interface_present (strIfName) then wscript.echo "Fatal error. Interface " + strIfName + " cannot be created because it already exists." exit Function end if dim ret, objRXP, objMatches Set objRXP = New RegExp : objRXP.Global = True : objRXP.Multiline = True objRXP.Pattern = "Interface '([^']+)' was successfully created" ' Create the interface ret = call_VBoxManage ("hostonlyif create") set objMatches = objRXP.Execute(ret(1)) if objMatches.count > 0 then strIfName = objMatches(0).SubMatches(0) end if ' If it does not exist after creation, let's abort if not is_hostonly_interface_present (strIfName) then wscript.echo "Fatal error. Interface " + strIfName + " does not exist after creation." exit Function end if ' Disable DHCP wscript.echo "Disabling DHCP server on interface: " + strIfName + "..." 'VBoxManage dhcpserver remove --ifname $strIfName 2>/dev/null call_VBoxManage "dhcpserver remove --ifname """ + strIfName + """" ' Set up IP address and network mask wscript.echo "Configuring IP address " + strIp + " and network mask " + strMask + " on interface: " + strIfName + "..." call_VBoxManage "hostonlyif ipconfig """ + strIfName + """ --ip " + strIp + " --netmask " + strMask end function Function delete_hostonly_interface(strIfName) ' Delete given host-only interface ' Returns: nothing wscript.echo "Deleting host-only interface: " + strIfName + "..." call_VBoxManage "hostonlyif remove """ + strIfName + """" end Function function delete_all_hostonly_interfaces() ' Delete all host-only interfaces ' Returns: nothing dim arrIfs, strIfName arrIfs = Split(get_hostonly_interfaces(), vbcrlf) ' Delete every single hostonly interface in the system for each strIfName in arrIfs delete_hostonly_interface(strIfName) next end function

commit_message:
Move console scripts, use entry points

This will allow for unit testing of the console scripts,
and uses pbr to manage entry points for them.

/opt/stack/cinder/bin/* scripts may be removed after
devstack is updated to call /usr/bin/cinder* instead.

Change-Id: I70cad15380be6506eea11a08826e9906ff365884

"""Starter script for Cinder Volume Backup.""" import os import sys import eventlet eventlet.monkey_patch() from oslo.config import cfg # If ../cinder/__init__.py exists, add ../ to Python search path, so that # it will override what happens to be installed in /usr/(local/)lib/python... possible_topdir = os.path.normpath(os.path.join(os.path.abspath(sys.argv[0]), os.pardir, os.pardir)) if os.path.exists(os.path.join(possible_topdir, 'cinder', '__init__.py')): sys.path.insert(0, possible_topdir) from cinder.openstack.common import gettextutils gettextutils.install('cinder') from cinder.common import config # Need to register global_opts from cinder.openstack.common import log as logging from cinder import service from cinder import utils from cinder import version CONF = cfg.CONF def main(): CONF(sys.argv[1:], project='cinder', version=version.version_string()) logging.setup("cinder") utils.monkey_patch() launcher = service.ProcessLauncher() server = service.Service.create(binary='cinder-backup') launcher.launch_server(server) launcher.wait()

commit_message:
Exception handle on unreachable trove-api

Reason: module has not attribute ConnectionError,
troveclient exception module has no class ConnectionError.
It causes attribute error.

Closes-Bug: #1240950

commit_message:
Enable create volume on force hosts

Cinder scheduler will help select host for create request based on
scheduler filters, but end user cannot create volume directly on a
force host.

This patch enhanced the option of "--availability-zone" for
"cinder create" to provide force hosts option. If end user specify
"--availability-zone zone1:host1", this means that customer want to
create the volume on force host host1.

Implements bp cinder-force-host

Change-Id: Ie281215bd18e015f3a8b41293fc1004181a5933e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/76/55076/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @staticmethod def _handle_availability_zone(context, availability_zone): # NOTE(jay-lau-513): We have a legacy hack to allow admins to specify # hosts via az using az:host. forced_host = None if availability_zone and ':' in availability_zone: c = availability_zone.count(':') if c == 1: availability_zone, forced_host = availability_zone.split(':') else: raise exception.InvalidInput( reason="Unable to parse availability_zone") if not availability_zone: availability_zone = CONF.default_availability_zone return availability_zone, forced_host handle_az = self._handle_availability_zone availability_zone, force_hosts = handle_az(context, availability_zone) 'force_hosts': force_hosts,

subject: Fixes Hyper-V snapshot spawning issue
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-11-25 18:20:05.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/26a629ec975471c11a228ea79f54f13b84cbe9b8', 'message': "Fixes Hyper-V snapshot spawning issue

In Hyper-V, snapshoting an instance and then spawning a new
one using the resulted snapshot image with the same flavor,
will result an Hyper-V Exception.

Hyper-V will get the request to resize the base image to it's
actual size, leading to an error.

The reason is that the logic of the resize_vhd method has been
changed, as it is meant to resize images to the flavor size minus
the image metadata size, thus it's maximum internal size. For this
reason, the way to decide whether the root image should be resized
or not must also be changed.

So, instead of comparing the root image and base image sizes,
we should compare their maximum internal sizes.

Closes-Bug: #1234759

(cherry picked from commit 751b7ecb58cb16964509f1d9a30eacadacfdf253)

Conflicts:

	nova/tests/test_hypervapi.py
	nova/virt/hyperv/imagecache.py
	nova/virt/hyperv/vmops.py

Change-Id: I83d2df76b726d705cedc52a8309a2be7037d6a79

we should compare their maximum internal sizes.

Closes-Bug: #1234759

(cherry picked from commit 751b7ecb58cb16964509f1d9a30eacadacfdf253)

Conflicts:
	nova/tests/test_hypervapi.py
	nova/virt/hyperv/imagecache.py
	nova/virt/hyperv/vmops.py

Change-Id: I83d2df76b726d705cedc52a8309a2be7037d6a79
"}]
commit_message:
Fixes Hyper-V snapshot spawning issue

In Hyper-V, snapshoting an instance and then spawning a new
one using the resulted snapshot image with the same flavor,
will result an Hyper-V Exception.

Hyper-V will get the request to resize the base image to it's
actual size, leading to an error.

The reason is that the logic of the resize_vhd method has been
changed, as it is meant to resize images to the flavor size minus
the image metadata size, thus it's maximum internal size. For this
reason, the way to decide whether the root image should be resized
or not must also be changed.

So, instead of comparing the root image and base image sizes,
we should compare their maximum internal sizes.

Closes-Bug: #1234759

(cherry picked from commit 751b7ecb58cb16964509f1d9a30eacadacfdf253)

Conflicts:
	nova/tests/test_hypervapi.py
	nova/virt/hyperv/imagecache.py
	nova/virt/hyperv/vmops.py

Change-Id: I83d2df76b726d705cedc52a8309a2be7037d6a79

commit_message:
Update openstack/common/lockutils

The following commits are in this update:

79e6bc6 fix lockutils.lock() to make it thread-safe
ace5120 Add main() to lockutils that creates temp dir for locks
537d8e2 Allow lockutils to get lock_path conf from envvar
d498c42 Fix to properly log when we release a semaphore
29d387c Add LockFixture to lockutils
3e3ac0c Modify lockutils.py due to dispose of eventlet
90b6a65 Fix locking bug
27d4b41 Move synchronized body to a first-class function
15c17fb Make lock_file_prefix optional
1a2df89 Enable H302 hacking check
b41862d Use param keyword for docstrings

Change-Id: I25a350b0f72e117e1beff92bba45f9c70c8cdc7c

commit_message:
Fix rebuild_server() function

The rebuild_server() function defined in the v2 and v3 base test
classes made some incorrect assumptions about variable scoping
because the method is set as a class method. This commit fixes this
method to behave properly so that it doesn't reference variables
outside it's scope.

Change-Id: I7d0ee6e0c0784952634b157187ca47f7afbcadf1

commit_message:
Migrate away from rackspace_resource

Having Rackspace specific resources subclass a the rackspace_resource
does not replace the clients system wide. Use the cloud_backend to
acomplish this. That way any special configuration done with pyrax
will be used in any client call.
Change-Id: Ia6d548e606a42c608135cb66876419d1b339a06c

commit_message:
Fix typo in keystone

1. Validate the user and tenant auth into in order to -> Validate the user
   and tenant auth info in order to
2. attmepting -> attempting
3. extnsion -> extension
4. identfier -> identifier
5. establed -> established
6. specifc -> specific
7. intitalized -> initialized
8. explicity -> explicitly
9. uniq -> unique

Change-Id: I8f4420e7c41cfdbc3f4751ed1c0b9a6e151b0940
Closes-Bug: #1254585

commit_message:
show diff between pip installed packages and requirements

This change will display the difference between which python packages pip
installed and the packages from the requirements lists.  It will print
the list of dependencies to the console (not including the directly declared
dependencies from the requirements list).

Closes-Bug: #1172417

Change-Id: I9363b50d6d7f5ef19c42bb2e30de45e352060ccd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/pbr refs/changes/39/54639/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # This function takes a list of files that contains # a list of python packages (in pip freeze format) and # creates a new file containing the intersect list # of packages without the version numbers. # $1 - The files containing python packages (with version). # $2 - The bare list of packages (without version). function gen_bare_package_list () { IN_FILES=$1 OUT_FILE=$2 truncate --size=0 $OUT_FILE for FILE in $IN_FILES do while read line; do if [[ "$line" == "" ]] || [[ "$line" == \#* ]] || [[ "$line" == \-f* ]]; then continue elif [[ "$line" == \-e* ]]; then echo "${line#*=}" >> $OUT_FILE elif [[ "$line" == *\>* ]]; then echo "${line%%>*}" >> $OUT_FILE elif [[ "$line" == *\=* ]]; then echo "${line%%=*}" >> $OUT_FILE elif [[ "$line" == *\<* ]]; then echo "${line%%<*}" >> $OUT_FILE else echo "${line%%#*}" >> $OUT_FILE fi done < $FILE done } $jeepybvenv/bin/run-mirror -b remotes/origin/master --verbose -c $tmpdir/mirror.yaml --no-process --export=$HOME/mirror_package_list.txt # Compare packages in the mirror with the list of requirements gen_bare_package_list "$REPODIR/requirements/global-requirements.txt $REPODIR/requirements/dev-requirements.txt" bare_all_requirements.tx gen_bare_package_list $HOME/mirror_package_list.txt bare_mirror_package_list.txt echo "Diff between python mirror packages and requirements packages:" grep -v -f bare_mirror_package_list.txt bare_all_requirements.txt > diff_requirements_mirror.txt cat diff_requirements_mirror.txt

commit_message:
Allow deploying keystone with SSL certificates

Allow providing certificates through environment variables to be used
for keystone, and provide the basis for doing this for other services.
It cannot be used in conjunction with tls-proxy as the service provides
it's own encrypted endpoint.

Impletmenting: blueprint devstack-https
Change-Id: I8cf4c9c8c8a6911ae56ebcd14600a9d24cca99a0

Changes in devstack and nodepool will allow for pre-cached get-pip
script to be used, instead of downloading from the internets. Enable
the flag so that the cached script and the local mirror will be used

Closes-Bug: #1254275
Change-Id: Ia5f69073f7f9bab9b5554185df5681fbd178b91d
'}]
commit_message:
Use get-pip for pip installation

Changes in devstack and nodepool will allow for pre-cached get-pip
script to be used, instead of downloading from the internets. Enable
the flag so that the cached script and the local mirror will be used
for pip installation.

Closes-Bug: #1254275
Change-Id: Ia5f69073f7f9bab9b5554185df5681fbd178b91d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack-gate refs/changes/06/58106/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: USE_GET_PIP=1

commit_message:
Remove vim header

No need to set tabstop 189 times, this can be set in your vimrc file
instead.  Also if set incorrectly gate (pep8 check) will catch your
mistakes.

Change-Id: Ic6f0c0ef94e8194a5c121598305d1ec3c74e4843

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-12-03 15:44:52.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.messaging/commit/ad4af954a59a1149eb10b4200140e36b787f5479', 'message': 'Unify different names between Python2/3 with six.moves

Some modules use different names in Python2 and Python3. Use six.moves
to make them work well in Python2 and Python3.
This is changes mapping:

six.moves      Python 2                 Python 3
builtins        __builtin__                 builtins
filter             itertools.ifilter()      filter()
reduce             reduce()                 functools.reduce()
reload_module  reload()             imp.reload()

Implements: blueprint make-python3-compatible
Change-Id: I97971f2ab40385bfc2c73ae7e8a7620c4d64a03c
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2013-12-03 22:17:40.000000000', 'files': ['oslo/messaging/_drivers/impl_zmq.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.messaging/commit/ae60d4ad77adb29de8bdcb3bdbd476fda35b67f4', 'message': 'Unify different names between Python2/3 with six.moves

Some modules use different names in Python2 and Python3. Use six.moves
to make them work well in Python2 and Python3.
This is changes mapping:

six.moves      Python 2       Python 3
reduce         reduce()      functools.reduce()

Implements: blueprint make-python3-compatible
Change-Id: I97971f2ab40385bfc2c73ae7e8a7620c4d64a03c
'}]
commit_message:
Unify different names between Python2/3 with six.moves

Some modules use different names in Python2 and Python3. Use six.moves
to make them work well in Python2 and Python3.
This is changes mapping:

six.moves      Python 2       Python 3
reduce         reduce()      functools.reduce()

Implements: blueprint make-python3-compatible
Change-Id: I97971f2ab40385bfc2c73ae7e8a7620c4d64a03c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.messaging refs/changes/57/59757/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: zmq_msg = reduce(lambda x, y: x + y, rpc_envelope.items())

added_lines: OpenStack dashboard is a web-based interface that allows you to manage OpenStack resources and services. For information about installing and configuring the dashboard, see the <citetitle>OpenStack Installation Guide</citetitle> for your distribution. After you install and configure the dashboard, complete these tasks:</para> <para>Customize your dashboard. commit_message:
Ensure ml2 is set in core_plugin

When using ML2 plugin, we need to ensure that core_plugin flag
is set to the right class in neutron.conf.
This patch add documentaiton in init.pp and testing in the manifest to
ensure that the right plugin is configured.

Change-Id: I706db60dc07f468b920a9c3b233a5665df5a3a73
Signed-off-by: Emilien Macchi <emilien.macchi@enovance.com>

commit_message:
Adds a debug flag to run_tests.sh

Using -d or --debug will run testtools instead of testr. This allows a
developer to use 'import pdb; pdb.set_trace()' to enter an interactive
debugging session.

Implements bp runtest-allow-debug

Change-Id: I13181f49e03e7c81b32763b2653eab4700db1e8c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/89/55289/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: echo " -d, --debug Run tests with testtools instead of testr. This allows you to use the debugger." -d|--debug) debug=1;;testropts=debug=0 if [ $debug -eq 1 ]; then if [ "$testropts" = "" ] && [ "$testrargs" = "" ]; then # Default to running all tests if specific test is not # provided. testrargs="discover ./keystone/tests" fi ${wrapper} python -m testtools.run $testropts $testrargs # Short circuit because all of the testr and coverage stuff # below does not make sense when running testtools.run for # debugging purposes. return fi testropts="--subunit $testropts"

subject: Fixed DB test cases on PyPy
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-12-02 20:28:44.000000000', 'files': ['swift/common/db.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/9b38463b06ff48269668a6b05822b285d603c7f8', 'message': "Fixed DB test cases on PyPy

They weren't working because of the intersection between some monkey
patching in the tests and the fact that ``sqlite3.Connection`` and
``Cursor`` are Python classes on PyPy, but C-extension classes on
CPython. The result was that trying to call the superclass's init
didn't work because the name ``sqlite3.Connection`` pointed to a
different class that wasn't actually the real superclass of
``GreenDBConnection``. Using ``super`` fixes this because the method
called is now always the real superclass's.

Change-Id: Ib45b16c7499883e560877788f13285d0a47cc2cd
"}]
commit_message:
Fixed DB test cases on PyPy

They weren't working because of the intersection between some monkey
patching in the tests and the fact that ``sqlite3.Connection`` and
``Cursor`` are Python classes on PyPy, but C-extension classes on
CPython. The result was that trying to call the superclass's init
didn't work because the name ``sqlite3.Connection`` pointed to a
different class that wasn't actually the real superclass of
``GreenDBConnection``. Using ``super`` fixes this because the method
called is now always the real superclass's.

Change-Id: Ib45b16c7499883e560877788f13285d0a47cc2cd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/33/59533/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: super(GreenDBConnection, self).__init__(database, 0, *args, **kwargs) super(GreenDBCursor, self).__init__(*args, **kwargs)

commit_message:
One transaction per call to sql assignment backend

There are numerous schedules that lead to inconsistent data in the
various grant tables and role table. These races arose from a lack of
synchronization during grant table modification (i.e., during grant
record creation + deletion and role deletion) and deletions of records
that grant records refer to (i.e., user, group, domain, and project
records). The races manifested as 404 errors in response to API
requests. This patch adds the necessary synchronization by way of
transactions.

Also removed pointless session.flush() calls at the ends of transactions.

Closes-Bug: #1246489
Change-Id: I958d48bafc7fcb95f1d9ea71e408b4cefc2469c9

commit_message:
Docs: layout our docs like the official openstack docs

Model the sections on http://docs.openstack.org/

Have the following sections:
- getting started
- install
- configure and run
- develop applications
- contribute

This will make future integration with the official docs easier and
it makes our docs more familiar to readers of openstack docs.

Change-Id: Ib84cfd4451b0e4e2569f8a3e027104d3457bb92e

commit_message:
Removes Unneeded mysql::server Dependency

Previously, the heat::db::mysql class contained a dependency on
mysql::server. This dependency is unneeded since mysql::db requires
mysql::config, which depends on mysql::server. Additionally, the
mysql::server dependency causes MYSQL HA installations such as
Galera to fail. Lastly, this aligns the class more closely with
the other [OPENSTACK_SERVICE]::db::mysql classes.

Change-Id: Ie6c4d3c8aaa531502bc5b9cd66a547f1f506385f

commit_message:
API: Fix the sensor_type and value

Convert everything to a string in the custom setter
as we don't know the order that the value and sensor_type are written,
so convert to the desired type in get_value().

part of blueprint api
Change-Id: Ia0c9883cecd6beea8ab8dff2c6b63c31e588819e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/solum refs/changes/71/58171/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: SENSOR_TYPE = wtypes.Enum(str, 'float', 'int') sensor_type = SENSOR_TYPE value = float

commit_message:
Test persistence and object registry

The test cases cover basic persistence and object registry loading
unloading, more tests WIP

Change-Id: I01421eedd8db65c93d9a02ed91715571015c4348

added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. """ test_objects ---------------------------------- Tests for solum 'objects' module """ from solum import objects, tests from solum.objects import base from solum.tests import utils class TestObjects(tests.TestCase): def setUp(self): super(tests.TestCase, self).setUp() utils.setup_dummy_db() utils.reset_dummy_db() self.ctx = utils.dummy_context() def tearDown(self): super(tests.TestCase, self).tearDown() def test_objects_registered(self): objects.load() assert objects.registry.Application assert objects.registry.ApplicationList def test_objects_reloadable(self): objects.load() assert objects.registry.Application self.addCleanup(objects.load) objects.registry.clear() self.assertRaises(AttributeError, lambda: base.registry.Application) def test_object_creatable(self): objects.load() app = objects.registry.Application() assert app assert app.id is None def test_object_persist_and_retrieve(self): objects.load() app = objects.registry.Application() assert app app.create(self.ctx) assert app.id is not None app2 = objects.registry.Application.get_by_id(None, app.id) assert app2 assert app.id == app2.id query = utils.get_dummy_session().query(app.__class__)\ .filter_by(id=app.id) assert query.first().id == app.id

  - attach.end
  - detach.start
  - detach.end

Blueprint: attachment-notifications

subject: Use channel_timeout for SSH connection timeout
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-11-27 13:42:51.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/common/ssh.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/b20cf3a30d42ed2ce0c34e338edf498258dfd721', 'message': 'Use channel_timeout for SSH connection timeout

Occasionally, SSH will get wedged so that a connection attempt is stuck
forever. When this happens, we need Tempest to abort the attempt and try
again. Currently, the individual connection timeout is set to the
overall timeout, so there will only ever be one attempt if this happens.
Using the channel_timeout instead will ensure that multiple connection
attempts are made even when the connection is wedged.

Fixes bug 1236524

Change-Id: Ie8dff41780bbf004cff5c880db202a8ae23a85c1
'}]
commit_message:
Use channel_timeout for SSH connection timeout

Occasionally, SSH will get wedged so that a connection attempt is stuck
forever. When this happens, we need Tempest to abort the attempt and try
again. Currently, the individual connection timeout is set to the
overall timeout, so there will only ever be one attempt if this happens.
Using the channel_timeout instead will ensure that multiple connection
attempts are made even when the connection is wedged.

Fixes bug 1236524

Change-Id: Ie8dff41780bbf004cff5c880db202a8ae23a85c1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/65/58765/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: timeout=self.channel_timeout, pkey=self.pkey)

commit_message:
Revert "Store DIB_* only env variables"

This reverts commit 7c2d1b2295fb2f6f92896795e36f8f49e6f7d55a

We want to capture aggressively to aid reproducability and diagnosing issues. Environment variables are not suitable storage for credentials, it's not up to us to police that.
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder refs/changes/21/59621/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: export DIB_ENV=$(export)

commit_message:
Inline Table editing

Implementation of inline-table-editing blueprint:

- Design from jcoufal is implemented with Bootstrap elements.
- Inline edit mode implemented, Django Form Field connected to table
  logic, using Django Form Widget to render. Table Cell can be updated
  and refreshed.
- Allowed method implemented for checking of cell edit permissions
- Validation process is taken from Django Form Field logic, so
  validation is defined as part of Django Form Field defined in table
  Column.
- Update method of the cell is defined as Table Action. For obtaining
  row data, UpdateRow functionality is used.
- Horizon Tests for inline editing implemented.
- Selenium Tests for inline editing of tenants implemented
- Documentation written in both ref and topics

Change-Id: Ib29b58da71d3a8abc9688bc942fe49917161e97a
Implements: blueprint inline-table-editing

added_lines: from .workflows import LaunchInstance, UpdateInstance, UpdateInstanceNameclass UpdateNameView(workflows.WorkflowView): workflow_class = UpdateInstanceName success_url = reverse_lazy("horizon:project:instances:index") def get_context_data(self, **kwargs): context = super(UpdateNameView, self).get_context_data(**kwargs) context["instance_id"] = self.kwargs['instance_id'] return context def get_object(self, *args, **kwargs): if not hasattr(self, "_object"): instance_id = self.kwargs['instance_id'] try: self._object = api.nova.server_get(self.request, instance_id) except: redirect = reverse("horizon:project:instances:index") msg = _('Unable to retrieve instance details.') exceptions.handle(self.request, msg, redirect=redirect) return self._object def get_initial(self): initial = super(UpdateNameView, self).get_initial() initial.update({'instance_id': self.kwargs['instance_id'], 'name': getattr(self.get_object(), 'name', '')}) return initial

commit_message:
Add unit tests for volume reserve and unreserve

This adds unit tests for successful reserving and unreserving, and vice
versa for not being in the right status.

Change-Id: Iaa777055315251efa4a14976e25b9baab222f934
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/43/57843/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import mock @mock.patch.object(db, 'volume_get') @mock.patch.object(cinder.volume.api.API, 'update') def test_reserve_volume_success(self, volume_get, volume_update): fake_volume = { 'id': 'aaaaaaaa-aaaa-aaaa-aaaa-aaaaaaaaaaa', 'status': 'available', } volume_get.return_value = fake_volume volume_update.return_value = fake_volume self.assertIsNone(cinder.volume.api.API().reserve_volume( self.context, fake_volume, )) def test_reserve_volume_bad_status(self): fake_volume = { 'id': 'aaaaaaaa-aaaa-aaaa-aaaa-aaaaaaaaaaa', 'status': 'in-use', } with mock.patch.object(db, 'volume_get', lambda *args: fake_volume): self.assertRaises(exception.InvalidVolume, cinder.volume.api.API().reserve_volume, self.context, fake_volume) def test_unreserve_volume_success(self): fake_volume = { 'id': 'aaaaaaaa-aaaa-aaaa-aaaa-aaaaaaaaaaa', 'status': 'attaching', } with mock.patch.object(cinder.volume.api.API, 'update', lambda *args: fake_volume): self.assertIsNone(cinder.volume.api.API().unreserve_volume( self.context, fake_volume )) def test_unreserve_volume_bad_status(self): fake_volume = { 'id': 'aaaaaaaa-aaaa-aaaa-aaaa-aaaaaaaaaaa', 'status': 'available', } self.assertRaises(exception.InvalidVolume, cinder.volume.api.API().unreserve_volume, self.context, fake_volume)

commit_message:
Start dnsmasq if it failed for some reason

Idea is to start dnsmasq if it was killed or stopped
for some reason. This is done within periodic_resync_helper.

Change-Id: I0217a0208d0797c67ca6d5cfdadf8c32443aa17f
Closes-Bug: 1244783
Co-Authored-By: Hirofumi Ichihara <ichihara.hirofumi@lab.ntt.co.jp>

commit_message:
If no block devices abort deployment

Based on https://review.openstack.org/#/c/56525

Make the deployment to abort immediately in case the block devices are
not available.

Change-Id: Id1a23578b0e6c7f69bbf6e5a76f3e42f37980ba6
Partial-Bug: #1251525

added_lines: from ironic.common import exception class WorkOnDiskTestCase(tests_base.TestCase): def setUp(self): super(WorkOnDiskTestCase, self).setUp() self.image_path = '/tmp/xyz/image' self.root_mb = 128 self.swap_mb = 64 self.dev = '/dev/fake' self.root_part = '/dev/fake-part1' self.swap_part = '/dev/fake-part2' self.mock_ibd = mock.patch.object(utils, 'is_block_device').start() self.mock_mp = mock.patch.object(utils, 'make_partitions').start() self.addCleanup(self.mock_ibd.stop) self.addCleanup(self.mock_mp.stop) def test_no_parent_device(self): self.mock_ibd.return_value = False self.assertRaises(exception.InstanceDeployFailure, utils.work_on_disk, self.dev, self.root_mb, self.swap_mb, self.image_path) self.mock_ibd.assert_called_once_with(self.dev) self.mock_mp.assert_not_called() def test_no_root_partition(self): self.mock_ibd.side_effect = [True, False] calls = [mock.call(self.dev), mock.call(self.root_part)] self.assertRaises(exception.InstanceDeployFailure, utils.work_on_disk, self.dev, self.root_mb, self.swap_mb, self.image_path) self.assertEqual(self.mock_ibd.call_args_list, calls) self.mock_mp.assert_called_once_with(self.dev, self.root_mb, self.swap_mb) def test_no_swap_partition(self): self.mock_ibd.side_effect = [True, True, False] calls = [mock.call(self.dev), mock.call(self.root_part), mock.call(self.swap_part)] self.assertRaises(exception.InstanceDeployFailure, utils.work_on_disk, self.dev, self.root_mb, self.swap_mb, self.image_path) self.assertEqual(self.mock_ibd.call_args_list, calls) self.mock_mp.assert_called_once_with(self.dev, self.root_mb, self.swap_mb)

commit_message:
Restrict sort_keys for stack lists

We are only allowing users to sort stacks on a subset of columns that
are known to be indexed.  Currently allowed sort columns are:

created_at
updated_at
name
status

Change-Id: Ib4f955336edd7d86a1b6bf98e38378b0d495d0dd
Closes-Bug: 1252116

commit_message:
Add config option to limit image tags

This patch adds the image_tag_quota config option. This allows a deployer
to limit the number of image tags allowed on an image for v2. The default value
is 128. If an image is somehow over the limit, tags can still be removed but no
more may be added.

Fixes bug 1252337
docImpact

Change-Id: I2036e2a88601d7c5aa85fad32d90fe0ed30b84c8

added_lines: tags = set([]) self.base_image.tags = set([]) class TestImageTagQuotas(test_utils.BaseTestCase): def setUp(self): super(TestImageTagQuotas, self).setUp() self.base_image = mock.Mock() self.base_image.tags = set([]) self.base_image.extra_properties = {} self.image = glance.quota.ImageProxy(self.base_image, mock.Mock(), mock.Mock()) self.image_repo_mock = mock.Mock() self.image_repo_proxy = glance.quota.ImageRepoProxy( self.image_repo_mock, mock.Mock(), mock.Mock()) def test_create_image_tag(self): self.config(image_tag_quota=1) self.image.tags = set(['foo']) self.image_repo_proxy.add(self.image) self.image_repo_mock.add.assert_called_once_with(self.base_image) def test_create_too_many_image_tags(self): self.config(image_tag_quota=0) self.image.tags = set(['foo', 'bar']) exc = self.assertRaises(exception.ImageTagLimitExceeded, self.image_repo_proxy.add, self.image) self.assertTrue('Attempted: 2, Maximum: 0' in str(exc)) def test_create_unlimited_image_tags(self): self.config(image_tag_quota=-1) self.image.tags = set(['foo']) self.image_repo_proxy.add(self.image) self.image_repo_mock.add.assert_called_once_with(self.base_image) def test_add_image_tag(self): self.config(image_tag_quota=1) self.image.tags = set(['foo']) self.image_repo_proxy.save(self.image) self.image_repo_mock.save.assert_called_once_with(self.base_image) def test_add_too_many_image_tags(self): self.config(image_tag_quota=0) self.image.tags = set(['foo', 'bar']) exc = self.assertRaises(exception.ImageTagLimitExceeded, self.image_repo_proxy.save, self.image) self.assertTrue('Attempted: 2, Maximum: 0' in str(exc)) def test_add_unlimited_image_tags(self): self.config(image_tag_quota=-1) self.image.tags = set(['foo']) self.image_repo_proxy.save(self.image) self.image_repo_mock.save.assert_called_once_with(self.base_image)

commit_message:
Updates .gitignore

To ignore swap files from getting into repository
currently the implemented ignore is *.swp
however vim adds more swap files if these files exists,
so improving this with *.sw?

Change-Id: I5c70908e32fc5316e395c72810fc45f5db8a7a77
Closes-Bug: #1255864

commit_message:
Bump to using SQLAlchemy migrate 0.8.2

Requirements project has updated this to be able to remove a custom
check for sqlalchemy migrate 0.7.3 . Bumping this requirement will
let us do that.

NOTE: version 0.8.1 had a borked version number so
we require 0.8.2 or greater due to that.

commit_message:
Bump hacking to 0.8

Due to Bump hacking dependency is not the 0.8, some compatibility checks with python 3.x are not being done on gate and it is bringing code issues.
This commit has a change in order to keep compatibility with the rules added in hacking 0.8

Change-Id: I610f589af297c711be7fc52fd1b9a80b3275f7a3
Partial-Bug: #1257301

commit_message:
Put test resources into own folder

Centralise all test resources (zonefiles, SSL certs and keys and
sample notifications) into a resources folder and update the tests
that use them accordinly.

Change-Id: If12516a4597df3da04d5c36aaf6262aafaa6cbce

commit_message:
Bump to sqlalchemy-migrate 0.8.2

This allows us to drop some unsightly sqlalchemy-migrate 0.7.3
patching.

The related requirements change is here:

  Icde6248ca102884323d7912bab0f4a716aa294ec

Change-Id: I5f80dfc07f8256716d025002fc1a1f47e58b2142

added_lines: from migrate import exceptions as versioning_exceptions from migrate.versioning import api as versioning_api from migrate.versioning.repository import Repository
deleted_lines: import distutils.version as dist_version import migrate from migrate.versioning import util as migrate_utilfrom cinder.openstack.common import log as logging LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) @migrate_util.decorator def patched_with_engine(f, *a, **kw): url = a[0] engine = migrate_util.construct_engine(url, **kw) try: kw['engine'] = engine return f(*a, **kw) finally: if isinstance(engine, migrate_util.Engine) and engine is not url: migrate_util.log.debug('Disposing SQLAlchemy engine %s', engine) engine.dispose() # TODO(jkoelker) When migrate 0.7.3 is released and cinder depends # on that version or higher, this can be removed MIN_PKG_VERSION = dist_version.StrictVersion('0.7.3') if (not hasattr(migrate, '__version__') or dist_version.StrictVersion(migrate.__version__) < MIN_PKG_VERSION): migrate_util.with_engine = patched_with_engine # NOTE(jkoelker) Delay importing migrate until we are patched from migrate import exceptions as versioning_exceptions from migrate.versioning import api as versioning_api from migrate.versioning.repository import Repository

commit_message:
Fix "in" comparisons with one element tuples

A single value enclosed in parentheses is not a tuple (it needs a comma
after the element) therefore the comparisons like 'if foo in ("bar")'
are wrong.

Closes-Bug: #1248443
Change-Id: I29a2227c9d83efc17ecfacc86d507d75edd4eaca

commit_message:
Revert "Don't call credentials_headers() twice"

When we create or update a stack, when deferred_auth_method=password
(which is the default in heat.conf), the client must pass the username
and password, even if they don't need to for authentication (ie
they're passing a token). Otherwise there's no username and password
in the context to store, and the engine validation in
heat/engine/service.py::_validate_deferred_auth_context fails.

No such issue exists when deferred_auth_method=trusts, which is why
this problem was missed during testing of the patch being reverted.

Note some fixup in addition to the revert was required to make the
tests pass, as ShellTestToken and ShellTestStandaloneToken now require
username/password set in the fake env.

This reverts commit a7ba3c323b16227e0ba2527f21bc89625f125234
Change-Id: I0e7bc3f748022c2bf5ef7ef6dfe4d97953e3fcab

subject: Don't stop volume service for failed re-export operations
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-12-02 20:13:16.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/manager.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/e5d459ae7176f25c2b43606e37c049a52e54e5dc', 'message': 'Don't stop volume service for failed re-export operations

Commit b71570 "Set vol driver initialized before deleting volumes"
changed the manager behavior to call set_initialized() before
attempting to re-export volumes.

Drivers should not be considered initialized before re-export has
succeeded.  Otherwise a failure to export causes the volume
service to stop, when that failure should be handled like any other
failure to initialize.

Closes-Bug: 1257049
Related-Bug: 1232177
Change-Id: Ic6bc89ef3f15dbbc971fdd8c91117cccb5c2801b
'}]
commit_message:
Don't stop volume service for failed re-export operations

Commit b71570 "Set vol driver initialized before deleting volumes"
changed the manager behavior to call set_initialized() before
attempting to re-export volumes.

Drivers should not be considered initialized before re-export has
succeeded.  Otherwise a failure to export causes the volume
service to stop, when that failure should be handled like any other
failure to initialize.

Closes-Bug: 1257049
Related-Bug: 1232177
Change-Id: Ic6bc89ef3f15dbbc971fdd8c91117cccb5c2801b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/31/59531/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: try: for volume in volumes: if volume['status'] in ['available', 'in-use']: self.driver.ensure_export(ctxt, volume) elif volume['status'] == 'downloading': LOG.info(_("volume %s stuck in a downloading state"), volume['id']) self.driver.clear_download(ctxt, volume) self.db.volume_update(ctxt, volume['id'], {'status': 'error'}) else: LOG.info(_("volume %s: skipping export"), volume['id']) except Exception as ex: LOG.error(_("Error encountered during " "re-exporting phase of driver initialization: " " %(name)s") % {'name': self.driver.__class__.__name__}) LOG.exception(ex) return # at this point the driver is considered initialized. self.driver.set_initialized()
deleted_lines: # at this point the driver is considered initailized. # next re-initialize exports and clean up volumes that # should be deleted. self.driver.set_initialized() for volume in volumes: if volume['status'] in ['available', 'in-use']: self.driver.ensure_export(ctxt, volume) elif volume['status'] == 'downloading': LOG.info(_("volume %s stuck in a downloading state"), volume['id']) self.driver.clear_download(ctxt, volume) self.db.volume_update(ctxt, volume['id'], {'status': 'error'}) else: LOG.info(_("volume %s: skipping export"), volume['id'])

subject: Add API endpoint to query build information
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-11-06 16:16:10.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/3147c57f7b4c65cbdcd70ca659a2e36b2bd3e1b8', 'message': "Add middleware to query build information

This middleware captures requests to '/build_info' and uses PBR to
supply build information.

PBR's current release information is very similar to git describe and
is determined according to the following rules:

1) Get version from setup.cfg (VERSION)
2) Find the most recent annotated git tag object (TAG).
3) Count the number of commits since TAG (X)
4) Get the hash of the current commit (YYYYYY)

The release information will be formatted in one of three possible ways:

1) If TAG matches the current commit:
        release: TAG

2) If VERSION is supplied in setup.cfg:
        release: VERSION.devX.gYYYYYY

3) If a version is not provided:
        release: LAST_TAG.X.gYYYYYY

Implements: blueprint heat-build-info
Change-Id: Ibb2f5afda7c5d7c314e5e062d618405d9f4eb318

commit_message:
update to hacking 0.8

hacking 0.8 brings us a working H302 rule (should import modules
not objects) and a bunch of python 3 compat rules.

fix the python 3 compat issues to make this landable.

Change-Id: I53abf39394afc54da5ad049802dca0032f14882d

added_lines: The swift module is a part of [Stackforge](https://github.com/stackforge), an effort by the Openstack infrastructure team to provide continuous integration testing and code review for Openstack and Openstack community projects not part of the core software. The module itself is used to flexibly configure and manage the object storage service for Openstack.To utilize the swift module's functionality you will need to declare multiple resources. The following is a modified excerpt from the [openstack module](https://github.com/stackforge/puppet-openstack). This is not an exhaustive list of all the components needed, we recommend you consult and understand the [openstack module](https://github.com/stackforge/puppet-openstack) and the [core openstack](http://docs.openstack.org) documentation.Time before a partition can be moved.Then, it creates an instance of defined class for the xfs file system that will eventually lead the mounting of the device using the swift::storage::mount define.* Upstream is now part of stackforge.

commit_message:
Use oslo-rootwrap in config directory names

Use oslo-rootwrap rather than oslo.rootwrap in directory names
(/etc/oslo-rootwrap and /usr/share/oslo-rootwrap), as suggested by
Chuck. Since this package is actually consumed through its binary
(oslo-rootwrap) rather than its library (oslo.rootwrap), this is
probably more appropriate.

Change-Id: I0e249d70937307b5fe116750923c20d487506c97
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.rootwrap refs/changes/45/59745/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

For example,`/usr/share/oslo-rootwrap/compute.filters` installed. The file should be owned ``filters_path=/etc/oslo-rootwrap/filters.d,/usr/share/oslo-rootwrap````root_helper='sudo oslo-rootwrap /etc/oslo-rootwrap/rootwrap.conf``

commit_message:
Add option to return disk usage report with byte suffix.

Disk usage is currently returned as bytes. This patch adds the option
to return the value with a more human-friendly suffix, eg. MB/GB/TB/PB.

Change-Id: I3d55181f7e6085e711bd6e09ea2ce0a12b290cc5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/81/59481/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def size_suffix(size): suffixes = ['bytes', 'kB', 'MB', 'GB', 'TB', 'PB', 'EB', 'ZB', 'YB'] for suffix in suffixes: if size < 1000: return size, suffix size = size / 1000 return "%s %s" % (size, suffix) def disk_usage(self, hosts, top=0, size_suffix=False): if size_suffix: raw_used = size_suffix(raw_used) raw_avail = size_suffix(raw_avail) raw_total = size_suffix(raw_total) avg_used = size_suffix(avg_used) usage: %prog <server_type> [-v] [--suppress] [-a] [-r] [-u] [-d] [-l] [--md5] [--auditor] [--updater] [--expirer] [--sockstat] [--size-suffix] args.add_option('--size-suffix', action="store_true", help="Use size suffix for disk usage report") self.disk_usage(hosts, options.top, options.size_suffix)
deleted_lines: def disk_usage(self, hosts, top=0): usage: %prog <server_type> [-v] [--suppress] [-a] [-r] [-u] [-d] [-l] [--md5] [--auditor] [--updater] [--expirer] [--sockstat] self.disk_usage(hosts, options.top)

commit_message:
Utilites for manipulating base64 & PEM

Add two new utility modules

  - keystone.common.base64utils
  - keystone.common.pemutils

Add two new unit tests to exercise the above.

  - keystone.tests.test_base64utils
  - keystone.tests.test_pemutils

Functionality in these utilities will be utilized to fix bug #1233838
in a subsequent commit. It is hoped these modules will moved to Oslo
common code. Each module has a doc string describing their purpose and
functionalty.

Change-Id: I3546674dcd9eddec2c378929dd3f759f667cfd5d
Partial-Bug: #1233838
